abstract.p: Piaggio USA, US subsidiary of Piaggio Europei, Italy, will reintroduce Vespa motorscooter in US market in November; US sales were halted in 1984 because scooters failed to meet toughened federal emissions standards; photo (M)

Vespas are back, and they are leading the pack. Of marathon runners, that is.

As the official motor scooter of the 2000 New York City Marathon, a red Vespa will lead more than 30,000 runners next Sunday. ''It will be a great announcement for the return of the Vespa,'' said Giancarlo Fantappie, president of Piaggio U.S.A., the American subsidiary of Piaggio Europei, based in Pontedera, Italy.

Made famous by Audrey Hepburn and Gregory Peck in ''Roman Holiday,'' the Vespa will be officially reintroduced next month in the United States. Sales were halted in 1984 because the Vespa did not meet toughened federal emissions standards.
The newly engineered scooter will be sold in special Vespa boutiques, Mr. Fantappie said, where ''you will smell a piece of Italy.''
